subject: Critical Thinking
title: Pre-Mortems: Imagining Failure Before It Happens
description: A short lesson to help you apply Pre-Mortems: Imagining Failure Before It Happens.

hook.text: Gary Klein's technique: before a project starts, imagine it failed spectacularly. Now explain why.

buildup.text: A pre-mortem reverses hindsight bias â€” instead of explaining failure after it happens, you predict it before.

discovery.text: It gives people permission to voice doubts. In normal planning, dissent feels disloyal. In a pre-mortem, it's the job.

twist.text: Klein found pre-mortems increase the ability to identify potential problems by 30% compared to standard planning.

climax.text: Amazon, Google, and the military use pre-mortems routinely. It costs nothing and catches groupthink early.

punchline.text: Imagine failure first. Prevent it second.

quiz.question: What is a pre-mortem?
options: Imagining a project has failed and explaining why before it starts
